result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript SENTENCING HEARING commencing JANUARY 15, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF2742 (41 Pages).
Transcript FINAL PRE - TRIAL commencing DECEMBER 8, 2015, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15CF2742 (15 Pages).

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Brandon A Wigley for Peter Hahn  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Justice point report received and filed.  
Case in court for sentencing on caser 15cf2742.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report dated 01-07-2016 received and filed.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT FILE. 
Case not on today's calendar for branch 17. Branch 44 approved case transferred to branch 17 for global resolution.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case 15CF2742 for the purposes of sentencing.  Court vacated final pretrial on 01-08-2015 and jury trial on 01-12-2015 in branch 44. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-15-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders continued monitoring.  Report placed in court file./ds
Violation report received and filed - 11-24-15 - missed telephone contact./ds
Branch 44 Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Zachary A Wittchow for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
In-chambers discussion placed on record.  Court orders case adjourned for another pretrial conference in Branch 44.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received the information that was requested from the State.  Defense needs to contact the attorney for the individual.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report dated 10-19-15 received and filed./ds

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State has always had the intention of complying with the information the defense requested.  However, the information is not available at this time and moves for an adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Motion to Compel Disclosure of Identity of Confidential Informant received and filed with court.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

ADA states he may be able to obtain the information for which the defense needs and asks case be set for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling.  Attorney Susan Roth appears in place of Attorney Douglas Bihler.  Parties filed a Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel signed by the defendant and both counsel on 8-26-15.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Motion and Stipulation for Substitution of Counsel received and filed./ds

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling. Discussion of the filed motion and associated purposed order. Defense just received discovery. No offer has been made. State is going to be charging another matter against the defendant, and because of this defense requested an adjourned scheduling conference date. Court granted the defense request.  Any motions should be filed by the next court date. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order from the State related to the Motion for Protective Order Pursuant to Wis Stat. 971.23(6) signed and filed. Copes given to the District Attorney and defense counsel.
Motion for protective order pursuant to Wis Stat. 971.23(6) from the State received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Letter from Douglas M. Bihler to District Attorney dated 07/02/2015 scanned.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Ronald Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/29/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Keavin Lenny Cotton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
